intro: Haumaniastrum callianthum, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features a basal rosette of fleshy, waxy leaves that help it retain moisture. Its showy yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The species is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient component of desert ecosystems.
